results.title: The effect of dietary fat content on plasma noncholesterol sterol concentrations in patients with familial hypercholesterolemia treated with simvastatin.
results.text_hl: These results suggest that a @<m>DISEASE_Oculocerebrorenal_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009800 @@@LFD@@@ may enhance the decrease in @CHEMICAL_Cholesterol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002784 @@@cholesterol@@@ synthesis induced by @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ treatment, and in this way might contribute to the decrease in plasma @CHEMICAL_Cholesterol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002784 @@@cholesterol@@@ levels when the fat content of the diet is reduced in @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@-treated @DISEASE_Hyperlipoproteinemia_Type_II @DISEASE_MESH:D006938 @@@FH@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@.

citations.NLM: Chisholm A, Sutherland W, Ball M. The effect of dietary fat content on plasma noncholesterol sterol concentrations in patients with familial hypercholesterolemia treated with simvastatin. Metabolism. 1994 Mar;43(3):310-4. PMID: 8139479
